University of Pretoria: The University of Pretoria (Afrikaans: Universiteit van Pretoria, Northern Sotho: Yunibesithi ya Pretoria) is a multi-campus public research university[17][18] in Pretoria, the administrative and de facto capital of South Africa.[19] The university was established in 1908 as the Pretoria campus of the Johannesburg-based Transvaal University College and is the fourth South African institution in continuous operation to be awarded university status. The university has grown from the original 32 students in a single late Victorian house to approximately 53,000 in 2019.[20] The university was built on seven suburban campuses on 1,190 hectares (2,900 acres).[15][16]
